trans-unit.source: How to update Azure Linux Agent to latest version from Github
trans-unit.target: How to update Azure Linux Agent to latest version from Github

trans-unit.source: Learn how to update Azure Linux Agent from Github for your Linux VM in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to update Azure Linux Agent from Github for your Linux VM in Azure.

trans-unit.source: How to update Azure Linux Agent to the latest version from Github
trans-unit.target: How to update Azure Linux Agent to the latest version from Github

trans-unit.source: To update your [Azure Linux agent](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent), you must already have:
trans-unit.target: To update your [Azure Linux agent](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent), you must already have:

trans-unit.source: a running Linux vm in Azure
trans-unit.target: a running Linux vm in Azure

trans-unit.source: You are connected to that Linux VM using SSH
trans-unit.target: You are connected to that Linux VM using SSH

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you will perform this task from a Windows computer, you can use Putty to SSH into your Linux machine.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you will perform this task from a Windows computer, you can use Putty to SSH into your Linux machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Linux](virtual-machines-linux-how-to-log-on.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Log on to a Virtual Machine Running Linux](virtual-machines-linux-how-to-log-on.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure-endorsed Linux distros have put the Azure Linux Agent package in their repositories, so please check and install the latest version from that Distro repository first if possible.
trans-unit.target: Azure-endorsed Linux distros have put the Azure Linux Agent package in their repositories, so please check and install the latest version from that Distro repository first if possible.

trans-unit.source: For Ubuntu, just type:
trans-unit.target: For Ubuntu, just type:

trans-unit.source: and on CentOS, type:
trans-unit.target: and on CentOS, type:

trans-unit.source: For Oracle Linux, make sure the add-on repository enabled in file `/etc/yum.repo.d/public-yum-ol6.repo` or `/etc/yum.repo.d/public-yum-ol7.repo`, then type:
trans-unit.target: For Oracle Linux, make sure the add-on repository enabled in file `/etc/yum.repo.d/public-yum-ol6.repo` or `/etc/yum.repo.d/public-yum-ol7.repo`, then type:

trans-unit.source: Typically this is all you need, but if for some reason you need to install it from https://github.com directly, use the following steps.
trans-unit.target: Typically this is all you need, but if for some reason you need to install it from https://github.com directly, use the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Install wget
trans-unit.target: Install wget

trans-unit.source: Login to your VM using SSH.
trans-unit.target: Login to your VM using SSH.

trans-unit.source: Install wget (there are some distros that don't install it by default such as Redhat, CentOS, and Oracle Linux versions 6.4 and 6.5) by typing `#sudo yum install wget` on the command line.
trans-unit.target: Install wget (there are some distros that don't install it by default such as Redhat, CentOS, and Oracle Linux versions 6.4 and 6.5) by typing `#sudo yum install wget` on the command line.

trans-unit.source: Download latest version
trans-unit.target: Download latest version

trans-unit.source: Open [the release of Azure Linux Agent in Github](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent/releases) in a web page, and find out the latest version number.
trans-unit.target: Open [the release of Azure Linux Agent in Github](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent/releases) in a web page, and find out the latest version number.

trans-unit.source: (You can locate your current version by typing `#waagent --version`.)
trans-unit.target: (You can locate your current version by typing `#waagent --version`.)

trans-unit.target: For the version 2.0.x, type:

trans-unit.target: The following line uses version 2.0.14 as an example:

trans-unit.target: For the version 2.1.x or later, type:

trans-unit.target: The following line uses version 2.1.0 as an example:

trans-unit.target: Install Linux Agent

trans-unit.target: For the version 2.0.x, use:

trans-unit.target: Make waagent executable

trans-unit.source: Copy new executable to /usr/sbin/
trans-unit.target: Copy new executable to /usr/sbin/

trans-unit.target: For the version 2.1.x, use:

trans-unit.target: You may need install the package `setuptools` first, see [here](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/setuptools).

trans-unit.source: Then run below:
trans-unit.target: Then run below:

trans-unit.source: Restart waagent service
trans-unit.target: Restart waagent service

trans-unit.target: For most of linux Distros:

trans-unit.target: For Ubuntu, use:

trans-unit.target: Confirm the Azure Linux agent version

trans-unit.target: For CoreOS, above command may not work.

trans-unit.source: You will see the Linux Agent version has been updated to new version.
trans-unit.target: You will see the Linux Agent version has been updated to new version.

trans-unit.source: For more information regarding Azure Linux Agent, refer [Azure Linux Agent README](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent).
trans-unit.target: For more information regarding Azure Linux Agent, refer [Azure Linux Agent README](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent).
